snippet: Two restaurants on the same street in San Francisco have been affected very differently by the government shutdown, despite nearly identical circumstances.
abstract: San Francisco restaurants Cliff House and Louis' have been affected very differently by the government shutdown, despite nearly identical circumstances; both restaurants are privately owned and sit on land that belongs to the National Park Service, but Louis' contract exempts it from closing under the shutdown, while Cliff House's contract does not, which owners say illustrates arbitrariness of rules set off by the shutdown.
lead_paragraph: Two restaurants on the same street in San Francisco have been affected very differently by the government shutdown, despite nearly identical circumstances.

headline.main: To Neighboring Restaurants, Shutdown Rules Are Nothing if Not Arbitrary
headline.print_headline: To Neighboring Restaurants, Shutdown Rules Are Nothing if Not Arbitrary
